page.title: 07Yarm Historical Characters
page.content: { }THOMAS BROWN On Saturday,March 23rd,1985, the regimental band and horse of{The {Queen's Own Hussars}visited Yarm to honour their hero,{ THOMAS BROWN.} He made his name at the{Battle of {Dettingen,}in Bavaria,on June 27th, 1743 while serving as a private in the regiment. In the midst of heavy fire from the French,the regimental standard was captured.Thomas Brown,then aged about 28,recovered it,showing great bravery in the process. The official account of his action reveals that he had two horses killed under him.His own injuries included having two fingers cut off,eight cuts around his face,head and neck.He also had two balls lodged in his back and three more passed through his hat.
